title: PM visits Information Ministry’s Digital Media Wing
content:
ISLAMABAD, July 14 (APP): Prime Minister Imran Khan on Wednesday visited the Digital Media Wing of the Ministry of Information and Broadcasting.
Minister for Information Fawad Chaudhry, who was also present on the occasion, briefed the Prime Minister regarding a comprehensive digitalization policy, under which national broadcasting institutions would be digitized in phases.
The Prime Minister, during his brief visit, was told that 11 digital media centers of the Associated Press of Pakistan (APP) fully equipped with modern facilities were being established in various cities of the country.
Prime Minister’s Focal Person for Digital Media Dr. Arsalan Khalid, General Manager Digital Media Wing Imran Ghazali and other officers of the wing briefed the Prime Minister about the performance of Digital Media Wing.
The Prime Minister appreciated the performance of Digital Media Wing for highlighting Pakistan’s positive image at international level.
